page.title: 01THE SOUTHERN WAVENEY VALLEY
page.content: The block, which straddles the Beccles to Bungay road, lies chiefly in the county of Suffolk and contains the two small and scattered villages of Barsham and Shipmeadow. The land gently slopes towards the marshes and floodplain of the River Waveney which lies to the north of the block. The area is very rural and the population about 200 is very scattered. The predominant occupation is agriculture, with a mixture of arable farming and fruit growing on the higher ground. The River Waveney forms part of the Norfolk/Suffolk Broads system, a popular venue for tourism and particularly boating holidays. The derelict lock at Shipmeadow forms the present limit of navigation on the river. The river marshes are chiefly used for grazing as they regularly flood in the winter.
